hackathon-eligibility: High school and college students ages 16 and older, and adults interested in taking on challenges are welcome! There are two categories of teams: high school and college/adult. You don’t have to be a member of a team to sign up. We’ll make sure to get you on one!
hackathon-requirements:
Submissions
* Teams should submit their code to Github:
hackathon-rules: to review agreements and download the legal forms you must fill out to participate.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: More than $5000 in cash and prizes is up for grabs!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=601 Genome Way Northwest, Huntsville, AL 35806, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How much impact (quality and quantity) can this solution have? Does this solution address the problem in a highly significant way?
How creative is the team’s approach? Is the solution new?  Does the solution represent something that isn't being addressed by the market?
How much progress did the team make during the event? Did they start from scratch or build on an existing solution?
How user friendly is the technology? How fully formed/mature is the idea?
Did the team effectively communicate their solution? Did they tell the story of the project and why it is important in a compelling way? How well did they respond to questions from judges?

hackathon-location-address: 601 Genome Way Northwest, Huntsville, AL 35806, USA
hackathon-description-header: Let's hack genomics and win prizes!
